title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez were sentenced to federal prison for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and must pay $12,528 in restitution; Baez got two years and must pay $10,285.
They stole and altered checks from USPS collection boxes between June 2023 and February 2024, then deposited them into controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen previously detained by ICE, invited to State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was arrested in May 2025 while en route to volleyball practice due to an expired student visa.
After community protests and support, Gomes released on $2,000 bond from a Burlington ICE facility following six days in detention.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark, laughing off the mishap afterward.
Swayman, despite a subpar performance, referenced his colorblindness humorously when discussing visibility issues during the game.
Team USA remains strong with goaltending options and has one more exhibition game before the Olympic elimination rounds begin.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum is nearing a return from an Achilles injury, potentially impacting the Celtics' playoff run.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony shared perspectives on Tatum's comeback, noting it could bolster the Celtics' lineup.
Tatum has been practicing, including with the G League affiliate, to regain rhythm before potential season debut.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space for offseason signings, eyeing upgrades.
Colts WR Alec Pierce identified as a key target for the Patriots, led NFL in yards per reception.
Packers OT Rasheed Walker seen as a potential improvement for Patriots' offensive line.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: MLB.TV is now available through ESPN's direct-to-consumer app, ESPN Unlimited, for $134.99 as an add-on for subscribers.
Non-subscribers of ESPN Unlimited can purchase MLB.TV for $149.99, which includes a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Current MLB.TV subscribers will automatically renew and can stream games on both the MLB app and ESPN app.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics' G League affiliate as he recovers from an Achilles tear.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement, noting Tatum performed like himself during the practice.
Celtics have not provided a return timetable for Tatum, who continues to be listed as out on the injury report.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the 2026 WalletHub study.
The state leads the nation with over 47% of adults holding bachelor's degrees.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third; Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction and closes on February 21.
The card, owned by the Bernstein family of Taunton, Massachusetts, is expected to sell for over $4.75 million.
Ken Goldin, from the Netflix series 'King of Collectibles', is handling the auction of the ungraded, 116-year-old card.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman to start for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman has a record of 22-12-3 with a 2.92 GAA and .903 save percentage this season.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also participate in the game alongside Swayman for Team USA.
